messages.message: Hi folks, hope this is the right place to ask. QQ: is it possible to take images that are OCR'ed and create a searchable PDF as the output. i.e. - we ingest a .tiff file (or some other image, .gif, .docx, etc.), and then produce a text-searchable PDF as output?

yes! it's possible to generate machine readable PDFs, Here is the documentation on how to generate it.
https://instabase.com/docs/reference/apps/flow/step-config-reference/process-files/#native-pdf-settings
cc: @Pranjal Rai if any help needed

Hey @Todd Pratt
Please let me know if you need any assistance or if something is not clear in the documentation.

Thanks gents, but the link looks like how you might process different document types.  I'm referring to how we might output into a searchable PDF.  i.e. - we might receive and email with a Word file, a Tiff, and a PDF ... as the last step of the flow, would we be able to output all of these into a searchable PDFs?

Hey Todd, You need to search for this flag in the documentation `native_pdf_settings`
```Native PDF Settings JSON: native_pdf_settings
none - Default. Do not use native pdf settings.
A JSON object with Native PDF settings to control the generation of native PDFs in the output for given input documents of the types image/PDF/tiff files.
write_native_pdf
true - Generate Native PDFs for the given input documents in the output under generated folder.
false - Don't generate any PDF in the output.
resolution_dpi - Takes an integer value between 72 to 300 and sets the resolution DPI of the resultant PDFs based on the value provided (Applicable only if write_native_pdf is True).```
and these searchable PDFs will be created in the output of Process Files under `generated` folder.
Ahhh... that's the stuff.  Missed it, sorry!
